meanings.definition: To deny the existence or truth of something.
meanings.sent1: She kept negating the idea that aliens exist.
meanings.sent2: He is always negating any rumors about himself.
meanings.sent3: The cat was negating the presence of the mouse in the room.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter negated the seriousness of the situation.
meanings.sent5: The detective's evidence was so strong, it was like negating any doubt.

meanings.sent1: Adding sugar can negating the bitterness of the coffee.
meanings.sent2: The medicine was negating the effects of the virus.
meanings.sent3: The magician's wand seemed to be negating the laws of physics.
meanings.sent4: Her smile negated all the negative comments.
meanings.sent5: The superhero's powers were so strong, they could negate any evil force.

meanings.sent1: His actions were constantly negating his words.
meanings.sent2: The witness testimony negated the suspect's alibi.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's jokes were negating the seriousness of the topic.
meanings.sent4: The bright colors of the painting seemed to negate the dark mood of the room.
meanings.sent5: The athlete's determination negated any doubts about his abilities.
